error.signature: RuntimeError: CUDA error: device-side assert triggered

verdict.summary: A CUDA kernel assertion failed on the GPU, typically due to out-of-bounds index or invalid label in loss function.

dead_ends.action: Restarting the Python process to clear the error
dead_ends.why_fails: Device-side asserts are sticky; error persists until GPU context is reset
GPU is in an error state; all subsequent CUDA operations will fail

workarounds.action: Set CUDA_LAUNCH_BLOCKING=1 to get the exact line that triggered the assert
workarounds.how: Forces synchronous kernel launches so the traceback points to the offending kernel

workarounds.action: Check loss function inputs: labels must be in [0, num_classes) range
workarounds.how: Most common cause is label index >= num_classes in CrossEntropyLoss

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'RuntimeError' indicates a CUDA kernel assertion failure (often bad tensor indices), while 'CUDA error' indicates an invalid next/image src prop.
'RuntimeError' indicates a CUDA kernel assertion failure (often bad tensor indices), while 'AssertionError' indicates PyTorch built without CUDA support.
